prompt.title: The Autonomous Medical AI
prompt.text: An autonomous AI has been developed that can diagnose illnesses and prescribe treatments with 99% accuracy, far surpassing any human doctor. However, in 1% of cases, its recommendations are catastrophically wrong. Should this AI be deployed in hospitals? Debate the ethical and practical implications.

exchanges.statement: We're wasting precious time debating perspective_difference when urgent action is needed NOW!
While I respect that perspective, my concern is that rushing could damage the trust and safety we've worked so hard to build.
Every moment we delay is a moment lost - bold action creates the evidence we need through real-world results!
